notes_display: Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three mural elements; covered korymbos, plain diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair; pointing upwards; large cheek flaps; neck-line of tunica edged with double row of pearls; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 12 h l. o. mzdysn bgy šhpwhry MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n/mazdēsn bay Šābuhr šāhān šāh Ērān kē čihr az yazdān/"the Mazda-worshiping, divine Shapur, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image/brilliance is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with parallel strokes; to the left and right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Shapur I without korymbos, facing outwards, holding lance in right hand respectively, left and right hand respectively resting on scabbard; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 9 h. l.o. NWRA ZY, 4 h l. a.  Šhpwhry| ādur ī Šābuhr|“the fire of Shapur”
